headline.main: Automakers Urge New EPA Chief to Withdraw Obama Car Fuel-Efficiency Rules
headline.print_headline: Automakers Urge New EPA Chief to Withdraw Obama Car Fuel-Efficiency Rules

docs.lead_paragraph: A trade association representing General Motors Co, Toyota Motor Corp, Volkswagen AG and nine other automakers on Tuesday asked new Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt to withdraw an Obama administration decision to lock in vehicle emission rules through 2025.

headline.main: Obama Shortens Sentence of Manning, Who Gave Secrets to WikiLeaks
headline.print_headline: Obama Shortens Sentence of Manning, Who Gave Secrets to WikiLeaks

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Tuesday shortened the prison sentence of Chelsea Manning, the former U.S. military intelligence analyst who was responsible for a 2010 leak of classified materials to anti-secrecy group WikiLeaks, the biggest such breach in U.S. history.

headline.main: Aggressive Cuts to Obama-Era Green Rules to Start Soon: EPA Head
headline.print_headline: Aggressive Cuts to Obama-Era Green Rules to Start Soon: EPA Head

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration will begin rolling back Obama-era environmental regulations in an "aggressive way" as soon as next week, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency said on Saturday - adding he understood why some Americans want to see his agency eliminated completely.

byline.contributor: Martin Fackler reported from Tokyo and James Kanter from Brussels. Ian Austen contributed reporting from Ottawa.

headline.main: Stimulus Bill Includes $50 Million for the Arts
